meanings.definition: To stop oneself from doing something
meanings.sent1: She refrained from eating the cookies before dinner.
meanings.sent2: He always refrained from interrupting others while they spoke.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy refrained from chewing on the shoes for once.
meanings.sent4: The driver refrained from pressing the accelerator, allowing the car to slow down gradually.
meanings.sent5: Despite the tempting offer, she refrained from buying unnecessary items.

meanings.definition: To hold back or restrain from an impulse or action
meanings.sent1: The teacher refrained from scolding the student in front of the class.
meanings.sent2: He refrained from shouting in anger, choosing to remain calm instead.
meanings.sent3: The comedian refrained from making jokes about the sensitive topic.
meanings.sent4: She refrained from revealing the surprise party plans to her friend.
meanings.sent5: The hiker refrained from taking the shortcut, opting for the safer path instead.
